name: 淘金

pages.text: $(thing)Panning$() is a method of obtaining small pieces of certain native ores by searching in rivers and other waterways.$(br2)Panning makes use of $(thing)Ore Deposits$() which are found in gravel patches in the bottom of lakes and rivers.$(br2)In order to get started panning, you will need an empty pan.
粘土可以$(l:getting_started/pottery)塑形$()成淘金盤，如上圖所示。
$(thing)塑形$()完成後別忘了$(l:mechanics/heating)燒製$()。$(br2)你找到的$(thing)沉積物$()可能包含幾種不同的礦石：原生銅、原生銀、原生金或錫石。

pages.name: 示例
pages.text: 板岩地貌中的原生金沉積物。
接下來你就可以開始淘金啦！$(br2)$(bold)1. $()對著含礦沉積物$(thing)使用$()淘金盤。$(br2)$(bold)2. $()站在水中時，手持淘金盤按住$(item)$(k:key.use)$()就可以開始淘洗盤中的砂礫。$(br2)$(bold)3. $()一小段時間後，如果你足夠走運，你就會獲得一小塊礦粒。

Panning can give three possible products: $(thing)Ore$(), $(thing)Loose Rocks$(), and $(l:mechanics/gems)Gems$(). The probabilities are as follows:$(br)$(li)Ore: 50%%$(li)Loose Rock: 25%%$(li)Gem: 1%%$()Each rock type has a specific gem that it will drop, that is exclusive to that rock type.
pages.title: Products of Panning
